text: Hawick Burghs was a district of burghs constituency of the House of Commons of the Parliament of the United Kingdom from 1868 until 1918. It consisted of the Roxburghshire burgh of Hawick and the Selkirkshire burghs of Galashiels and Selkirk. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party!!Notes |- |style="background-color: " | | 1868 | George Trevelyan | Liberal | later a Liberal Unionist |- |style="background-color: " | | 1886 | Alexander Laing Brown | Liberal |- |style="background-color: " | | 1892 | Thomas Shaw | Liberal | later Baron Craigmyle |- |style="background-color: " | | 1909 by-election | Sir John Barran | Liberal | |- |colspan="2" align="center"| 1918 |colspan="3"| constituency abolished |} ==Election results== Trevelyan George Otto Trevelyan was returned without opposition at the 1868 general election and again after acceptance of office at a by-election on 14 January 1869.Debrett's House of Commons, 1870 ===Elections in the 1860s=== Trevelyan was appointed Civil Lord of the Admiralty. ===Elections in the 1870s=== ===Elections in the 1880s=== Trevelyan was appointed Chief Secretary to the Lord Lieutenant of Ireland, requiring a by-election. Trevelyan was appointed Secretary of State for Scotland, requiring a by-election. ===Elections in the 1890s=== Shaw Shaw was appointed Solicitor-General for Scotland, requiring a by-election. ===Elections in the 1900s=== Shaw Conan Doyle Mackinder ===Elections in the 1910s=== Barran General Election 1914/15: Another General Election was required to take place before the end of 1915. The political parties had been making preparations for an election to take place and by the July 1914, the following candidates had been selected; *Liberal: John Barran *Unionist: Norman W. Grieve ==References== Category:Historic parliamentary constituencies in Scotland (Westminster) Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies established in 1868 Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies disestablished in 1918 Category:Hawick
title: Hawick Burghs (UK Parliament constituency)
